The following is a list of resources available to faculty and staff to learn how AHS can be a resource for your careers and daily lives.            AHS IT help desk       my.UIC       Campus resources       Resources quick sheet       Committees                  AHS Awards   View awards guidelines and submit your nomination            AHS Office of Research   Dedicated to supporting AHS researchers            Human Resources   Find information and resources to answer some of your most common human resource questions           Faculty resources        UIC promotion and tenure resources   View promotion and tenure forms, a calendar of important deadlines and more         AHS Promotion and Tenure Guidelines   Outlines AHS faculty appointments and promotion and tenure standards         AHS peer evaluation procedures   General expectations and guidelines         AHS faculty bylaws   Bylaws of the AHS faculty         AHS teaching load policy   Guidance in making AHS teaching assignments         UIC Faculty Affairs   Information and resources for faculty careers         AHS Clinical Fieldwork Placement Policies   Policy related to participation in clinical, fieldwork, experiential learning or professional training rotations/internships         Responding to Student Misconduct: Procedural Guidelines   Report suspected and actual violations of the University’s Standards of Conduct for students         Responding to Students Exhibiting Signs Emotional Distress: Procedural Guidelines   Take action to assist students reporting or exhibiting signs of stress or emotional distress         UIC Academic Affairs   Academic policies, priorities and initiatives                     AHS Faculty Mentoring Program  The AHS Faculty Mentoring Program supports junior faculty with their career development through mentorship from faculty within and outside of their respective academic departments. Junior faculty are strongly encouraged to attend mentoring introduction workshops, which are held twice a year. New faculty are invited to attend by the dean’s office.
